texts.en: Mutabar is 51 years old.  She is a loyal wife, mother and grandmother to three grandsons.  Mutabar and her family live in the city of Konibodom.  Mutabar has been working as a teacher at a local school for over 20 years.  Currently, she is an assistant director at the school.  Mutabar's salary is not high and this is why she has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years.  Her husband helps her with this business.  Mutabar wants to obtain a loan to buy several heads of livestock.  Then will increase her livestock headcount and grow her business.  Mutabar believes that she will be helped.  She hopes for Your support!

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Margaret decided to set up a cosmetics business in Takoradi.  She has 2 years worth of experience and is currently looking to further expand her enterprise.  Unfortunately, her expansion is limited due to a lack of funding.  

This loan will be used to help her purchase more cosmetics, thus enabling her to meet the demand of her customers.  She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a pharmacist) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary operates a provisions shop in Takoradi. She is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a sand contractor. She has been selling provisions for six years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. Mary hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ninfa is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo, eastern rural area of Freetown. She is married and blessed with five children. She started her business to take care of her family.

Fatmata runs a palm oil business from home; she sells palm oil and peppers. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Fatmata says that the main challenge to her business is the cost of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, a 48-year-old woman from Waterloo, an eastern area in Freetown.  She is married with 4 children.  Fatmata has operated her retail business for the past 11 years. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and charcoal to expand her business.  She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her wellbeing and increase her business.  In the future, Fatmata plans to open a food stuff table.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 46-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children.  She began her business because she wants to improve her status of living. In 2009, Fatmata established her local food business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometime sales are very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items like rice, sugar and milk to prepare her local food business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her installment. In the future, Fatmata plans to change her business to a provision shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, sugar and milk to prepare her local food business.

loans.name: Kadija

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Kadija from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is single and has one child.  For the past seven years, Kadija has had her clothing material business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home.  She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadija requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Kadija plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 53 years old and married with 11 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rosita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosita has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

Mary Jane has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 39-year-old Isatu from Waterloo Eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and has two children.  Her children are currently attending school. For the past 15 years, Isatu has had her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a poor road network.

Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and buy a generator to improve their standard of living. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.en: Juan Pedro is an enthusiastic Tlaxcalan farmer looking to improve yields from his small vegetable plot, while concurrently doing so in a healthier, more organic way. He also loves technology. His purchase of a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa covers both of these interests; with his digester, he will treat the manure produced by his small animals to generate renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer. The biogas will displace firewood and expensive, fossil-fuel derived propane in the kitchen and bathroom, and the biofertilizer will improve crop yields without him having to invest in petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his biodigester and included biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells second-hand clothing in Agona, Takoradi. She has been in this business for 5 years. She is married with three children. Due to difficult circumstances, Margaret did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a petty trader. Her income is mostly spent on supporting her husband (who is a photographer), paying her children’s school fees, and utility bills. She will use her loan to buy more second-hand clothing in order to expand her business, thus allowing her to meet rising customers. Her new profits from the expanded business will be used to assist in paying her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing in order to expand her business, thus allowing her to meet rising customers.

loans.name: Krista

texts.en:
Krista started her home-based business, "Krista’s Just Jewelry", after becoming a mother. She wanted to spend time with her children but also wanted to contribute to her household financially and provide for her husband and children.

What Krista needed was a job that she could do at home and that allowed her the flexibility of setting her own schedule, and, with "Krista’s Just Jewelry", Krista created the ideal work environment she was looking for. Through this business, Krista offers handmade bracelets, necklaces, and other small accessories and sells them at parties, local events and to her extended network of family and friends.

Krista will use this loan to purchase materials to make her accessories. Help this mother meet her loan goal and pursue her dream of being a successful working mom.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her small, handmade accessories.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
After years of working in the hospitality industry for most of her life, Angela realized there was a need for anonymity and discretion in the pest control business. It frustrated her to see pest control companies park their vehicles right outside of an establishment which raises concerns amongst patrons about the sanitation standards of the establishment and leaves the establishment scrambling to defend their reputation. Angela is now working with a part-time employee to help businesses and individuals get rid of pest problems discreetly.

Angela would like to use this loan to buy more equipment and chemicals which will allow her to offer a wider range of pest control services. She will also purchase accounting and payment processing equipment as well as a company van which she and her partner will use to travel to and from the client’s location. The loan will also help Angela advertise her business in local papers and possibly on the radio and online.

Help Angela meet her loan goal, expand the services she offers, buy a company van, and market her business. 

Check out Rest Assured Pest Solutions: www.restassuredpestsolutions.com.

loans.use: to purchase advertising space in local papers, online, and on the radio for her pest control business.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as an active person. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He describes his family challenge to be that they live in a dry area. He will use the 20,000 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful dairy farmer. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Susan is borrowing 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farm-related work for her rice-farming business.

Lita has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from making nipa roofing.

Lita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries for farm-related work

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 42 years old and married with one child.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, rice, sugar, soap, noodles, etc.

Nilda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Nilda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, rice, sugar, soap, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Irene works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from giving manicures and pedicures. Irene is borrowing 12,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Irene has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un joven de 22 años de edad, es soltero, estudio hasta bachillerato solo viven sus padres con él. 


Santiago se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas (maíz,  huisquil, ejote) tiene alrededor de 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad,  de la cual obtiene sus ingresos para salir adelante. Aprendió la actividad, porque algunas instituciones llevaban proyectos a la comunidad con el fin de hacer más rentables los cultivos.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la siembra  maíz y frijol. La parcela donde trabaja propio está  en el mismo solar, donde está su casa, pero trabaja para otro señor y le queda a 1 km de su casa para viajar lo hace a pie.
   

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 2 quintales de fertilizante, semilla de frijol ejote, también pagara mano de obra para la limpia del terreno, insecticidas para el control de plagas y que sus cultivos sean más rentables, comprara todos los insumos de una vez,  lo que le saldrá más económico.

     Uno de sus sueños, es preparar otra parte del terreno dejarla apta para establecerle sistema de riego, para en  la época seca sembrar siempre hortalizas y convertirse en un productor potencial  más de lo que hasta hoy es. Ayudará a mitigar los escases de recursos económicos. De las ganancias obtenidas se proyectara, cuanto invertirá en lo sucesivo en el nuevo ciclo del cultivo. De tal  modo, que sea una buena inversión para que al final logre lo que se ha propuesto y mejorar así sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is a 22-year-old young man. He is single, and he studied until high school. Only his parents live with him.

Santiago makes a living through planting vegetables (corn, huisquil, green beans). He has around 6 years of experience in this activity, from which he obtains his income to come out ahead. He learned this activity because some institutions began community projects with the goal of making more profitable crops. He has always grown corn and beans. The plot that he works is in the same site as his home, but he works for another man and that is 1 km from his house. To travel there, he goes by foot.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase 2 quintals (about 100 lbs.) of fertilizer and green bean seeds. He will also pay for labor to clear the land, as well as insecticides for pest control and to make his crops more profitable. He will purchase all of the supplies at once, which will be more economical.

One of his dreams is to prepare another part of the land and to make it capable of establishing an irrigation system so that in the dry season he is able to plant vegetables and become a potential producer more so than he has been until now. This will help to alleviate the shortage of economic resources. From the profits obtained he will project himself, as he will invest in the successive new cycle of cultivation. In that way, this will be a good investment so that at the end he is able to do what he has proposed, and  improve his income and help his family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 quintals (about 100 lbs.) of fertilizer and green bean seeds, as well as to pay the labor for clearing the land and insecticides to control pests.

loans.name: Marta Rosario

texts.es:
Marta, vive junto a su tía, su cuñada u sus abuelos, es una mujer que ha prendido a manejar su sala de bella sola y por iniciativa propia es una actividad que aprendió de su madre, lo atiende todos los días y sin un horario especificó. 
Solicita capital para comprar tintes, uñas, esmaltes, labiales, sombras, etc., con lo que espera que el inventario del negocio este muy bien surtido para atender a sus clientes, mejorar sus ganancias, cancelar las cuotas y ganar más clientes.
Sueña con tener los recursos económicos para estudiar una carrera universitaria que le de mejores oportunidades de superación personal.
texts.en:
Marta lives together with her aunt, her sister-in-law and her grandparents. She is a woman who has been able to manage her beauty salon alone and on her own initiative. She learned this profession from her mother. She serves customers every day, without a specific work schedule. 

She is requesting capital to buy hair dyes, nail polishes and extensions, lipsticks, eye shadows, etc. With this, she hopes that her business will have a very well-stocked inventory to serve her customers, improve her earnings, make the loan payments and attract more clients. 

She dreams of having the economic resources to study for a university degree, which would give her better opportunities for personal development.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, nail polishes and extensions, lipsticks, eye shadows, etc.

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Meet Memuna. She is a 50-year-old from Waterloo Masuba, Makeni; a northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 30 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. In 1998, Memuna established a cosmetic business within a busy market area.  She began this business because she was training in business, so she considered it as the only way out to survive. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is during the rainy season, as sales are very slow.

Memuna requires a loan in order to purchase more earrings, chains, creams, and bracelets for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, Memuna plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more earrings, chains, creams, and bracelets for resale.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Isata from Waterloo eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. She started the business to take care of her family. 

Isata runs a food stand business at home.  She sells rice, pure water and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2012. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Isata says that the main challenges to her business are the prices of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Isata has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business.  In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Nestor Miguel

texts.en: Nestor's family lives on the Tlaxcalan high plains, beyond the reach of the local electrical and natural gas networks. The family has therefore decided to benefit as much as possible from available natural resources. He has already invested in solar panels to provide electricity to his home and is now purchasing a 40-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to turn the abundant animal waste on his farm into multiple resources. He will use the digester to transform cow manure into renewable biogas and biofertilizer. His family will use biogas to cook, to heat bathwater, and to power a small generator for situations when the solar panels don't provide enough energy for the family's needs. The biofertilizer will be applied to his crops, improving soil quality and crop yields without resorting to petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. This loan represents 24% of the total cost of Nestor's Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor, accessories and generator.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix, es soltero no tiene hijos , vive en casa de sus padres se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16 de febrero Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario. El trabaja en una empresa donde exportan poleras; el cargo que ocupa es control de calidad esta hace mas de 10 años en esta empresa .
El crédito lo requiere para refaccion de su casa para compra de materiales (cemento estuco y otros) para asi poder vivir mas comodo.
El sueño de Felix  es tener comodidad par poder ofrecer a su futura familia.
Es el segundo que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Felix is single and has no children.  He lives in his parent's house, which is located in the 16th of February Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto.  He attended school until high school.  He works at a business that exports polo shirts.  His job is quality control, and he has worked at this business for more than ten years.

He is requesting this loan to repair his home and purchase materials such as cement, stucco, and others so that he can live more comfortably.  Felix's dream is to be able to offer his future family comfort.  This is the second loan he has requested from IMPRO and his first with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cement, stucco, and other materials to repair his home.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a hairdresser in Agona, Takoradi. She is a single mother, with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Millicent uses her income to provide food and pay utility bills, and other expenses for her family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of hair extensions, hair pomade, and hair relaxers to expand her business, thus aiding her to improve her overall profit. As a junior high school graduate, Millicent understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her child remains in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of hair extensions, hair pomade, and hair relaxers to expand her business, thus aiding her to improve her overall profit.

loans.name: Nuria Nohemy

texts.es:
Nuria de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es casada  y su esposo trabaja como jornalero en el área de hortalizas, los dos hijos que tienen viven con ella la primera tiene 16 años y estudia 1er año de bachillerato, el segundo tiene 7 años y actualmente estudia primer grado.

La señora se dedica a la venta de atoles, poleadas  y a veces frutas, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella  dice que cuando estaba pequeña sus padres sembraban hortalizas y ella salía a vender los productos y fue como perdió la pena para andar correteando la venta por las calles, luego su madre vendía atoles por la mañana en su casa, y cuando se separaron ella siguió haciendo venta que es de donde hasta hoy obtiene sus ingresos para la sobrevivencia de su familia. Antes de dedicarse a esta actividad tenía una venta de pupusas. 

El lugar a donde sale a vender le queda a 3 km de su casa y para llegar viaja en bus. Los horarios de trabajo generalmente son de 6.30 am. A  9.00 am.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 150 bloques, 5 metros de arena,  y $150.00 que tiene presupuestado pagar en concepto de madera.  Ella construirá su casa,  ya no vivirán en casa familiar y por lo tanto sus hijos tendrán más libertad, más recreación y vivirán en un ambiente más adecuado.


Nuria en seguida pretende  construir formalmente su vivienda, luego colocarle el piso adecuado para evitar enfermedades para su familia. Por otra parte, dice que su meta es ayudar con todo esfuerzo y dedicación a sus hijos a que sean profesionales en un futuro,  ya que una de ellas está en bachillerato y ve que se preocupa mucho por obtener buenas  calificaciones.
texts.en:
Nuria, 31 years old, studied until the ninth grade. She is married and her husband works as a day laborer in vegetables. Their two children live with her; the first is 16 years old and is in the first year of high school, while the second, who is 7 years old, is currently in the first grade.

The Señora sells atoles [corn based beverage], poleadas [hot drink made of flour and milk] and at times fruit. She has had this business for 7 years. She says that when she was small her parents planted vegetables and she went out to sell the crops and that was how she shed her embarrassment at traveling around selling in the streets. Then her mother used to sell “atoles” in the morning at her home. Later when Nuria and her husband separated she continued with her sales, which until today provide the income for her family’s survival. Before selling drinks, she used to sell “pupusas.” 

The area where she sells is about 3 km. from her house and she takes the bus in order to get there. Her work schedule is generally from 6:30 a.m. to 9 a.m.

She is requesting a loan to purchase 150 blocks, 5 meters of sand with $150 budgeted to pay for wood. She will build her own house since they will not be living in the family home and consequently her children will have more freedom, more recreation space and will live in a more suitable environment. 

Nuria hopes to immediately formally construct her dwelling and then install the right floor to prevent her family from getting diseases. Her goal is to put all her effort and dedication into helping her children become professionals in the future. One is already in high school and is very concerned about obtaining good grades.

loans.use: to purchase 150 blocks and 5 meters of sand, with $150 budgeted to pay for wood.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 50 years old with five children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Eden is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional seed and fertilizers for her business.

Eden has been farming vegetables for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a flower shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of flowers to sell for her flower shop business.

Riza has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of flowers to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc., for her general store business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, noodles, spices, etc., for her general store business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 10 years. Roselyn earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, chips, noodles, spices, etc.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es: Santos de 44 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas. Santos es una mujer admirable ya que trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y dar mejores condiciones de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de huevos y aceite desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como colabora con la economía de su hogar. Desea construir un muro de retención ya que desea asegurar su humilde casa y sus pocas pertenencias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Santos expresa tener la capacidad para cancelar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Santos is 44 years old and lives in a house she owns together with her life partner and their two daughters.  Santos is an admirable woman since she works very hard to improve life for her family and give them better living conditions.  She has worked selling eggs and oil for many years and this is how she contributes to the household.  

She wants to build a retaining wall since she wants to secure her humble home and its few belongings.  In order to do this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and iron.  Santos says she is able to make her repayments on the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and iron to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Dominga Guadalupe

texts.es: Dominga tiene 36 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su a su grupo familiar.  Desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja en una panadería cercana a su localidad y de esta forma lleva el sustento diario a su casa. Su vivienda es muy humilde la cual está construida a base de bahareque. Desea construir una pared con el fin de dividir para un cuarto y así poder tener mejores condiciones habitacionales. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para construir la pared lo antes posible. Confía que con lo que percibe de su trabajo logrará saldar el crédito en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Dominga is 36 years old and lives in poor conditions with her family. For a long time, she has worked in a bakery near her village and carries their daily food home. Her home is very humble, constructed of adobe. She wants to build a wall to divide a room so that they can have better living conditions. She applies for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, and iron to built the wall as soon as possible. She believes that her work will allow her to pay the loan by the established deadlines.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and iron to construct a wall in her home.

loans.name: Patron De San Jeronimo 5 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON DE SAN JERONIMO 5”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Timotea ella es conviviente y tiene 45 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de internet, negocio de venta de artículos de limpieza, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the 'Patron de San Jerónimo 5' communal bank, which is located in San Jerónimo district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Timotea has a life partner.  She is 45 years old and has two children.  She works in her business, a grocery store.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.  She has a stand, a grocery store, at the market.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had the business for one year, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting the loan to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

The other members have businesses like selling access to the internet, selling cleaning products, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

The member is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way and is committed to make her repayments within the agreed period.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Anemia

texts.en:
Anemia  is 59 years old, married and a resident of Oroquieta City, Mindanao, Philippines. In order to acquire an extra income for a living, she engaged in a buying and selling business. Anemia has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. 

Now, she is applying a loan of 7,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to restock more inventory. Additional inventory would increase her income, and from it, she can be able to sustain the other needs of her family. All she wants for her family is to have a decent and comfortable life with adequate income.

Anemia deeply wishes to maintain as a member in good standing with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to restock inventory for her buying and selling business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 39 years old and married with one child.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase stock like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell.

Arlyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Arlyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, canned goods, etc., to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is 63 years old, married and a resident of Burgos, Oroquieta City, Mindanao. He's been very responsible and a good provider for his family. He works hard to earn a living to support his family. Felipe has always had an interest in business; that's why he engaged in it through buying and selling. He has operated the business for seven years. Felipe also enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. 

Now, he is applying a loan of 14,900 PHP [Philippines peso] to restock more inventory for his buying and selling business. Expanding his inventories will increase his income, and from it, he wishes to have a stable income for his family. And someday, he hopes to buy a four-wheel vehicle to transport goods in other towns. All he wants for his family is to have a happy and comfortable life.

Felipe deeply wishes to maintain as a member in good standing with Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of inventory for his buying and selling business.

loans.name: Darna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Darna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Darna is borrowing 28,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Darna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and other equipment

loans.name: Concordio

texts.en:
Concordio is 59 years old, married, and a resident of Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquior, Philippines. They have six children who are adult-aged. Starting with a capital of 3,000 PHP, he opened a sari-sari store (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, he was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. He became a member last July 2013 and has taken out two loans. 

Now he is applying for 9,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for his sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, he wants to own a mini-mart someday, and he will be fully satisfied if he sees his children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, noodles, beverages, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Elkin Mauricio

texts.es: Elkin es un campesino dedicado a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, pues nació en el seno de una familia humilde que siempre se dedicó a las actividades agropecuarias. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien le ayuda cuando él realiza trabajos como jornalero en otras fincas cercanas, para complementar los ingresos familiares. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha sobrepasado diversos desafíos que se le presentan, especialmente por la lejanía de la vereda donde reside, lo que le aumenta los gastos de transporte. Sin embargo, sabe llevar la situación y siempre ha salido adelante, motivado por su esposa y su hijo. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar una cerda para crías y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción, especialmente para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, donde el consumo de esta carne se incrementa notablemente, mejorando así sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas. De esta manera, Elkin desea continuar trabajando arduamente para hacer de su actividad, un negocio rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, que le genere buenos ingresos y en un futuro poder tener la posibilidad de adquirir su propia finca en la que tenga sus animales y sus cultivos, generando mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar para los que ama.
texts.en:
Elkin is a farmer who raises and sells pigs.  He learned this work from his parents, since he was born in a humble family that always worked with the land.  He has the support of his wife, who helps when he works as a day laborer on other nearby farms in order to supplement the family income.  With effort and dedication, he has overcome different challenges that have presented themselves, especially the length of the path where he lives, which increases his transportation costs.  However, he knows how to manage the situation and has always made progress, motivated by his wife and son.  

He is requesting the support of this loan to purchase a breeding sow and feed to feed the animals, which will allow him to increase his production.  This will especially satisfy the demand that increases at the end of the year, when the consumption of this meat increases significantly.  This will improve his sales and the income he earns from them.  In this way, Elkin wants to continue working hard to do his work since it is a profitable and sustainable business over time.  It generates good income and in the future he can have the possibility of owning his own farm for his animals and crops, which would create better living conditions and well-being for those that he loves.

loans.use: to purchase a breeding sow and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like chicken, flour, spices, cooking oil, etc., for her food-vending business.

Gina has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like chicken, flour, spices, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ginabeth

texts.en: Ginabeth is 31 years old.  She is married and has seven children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Ginabeth is borrowing PHP7000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.  Ginabeth has been raising livestock for two years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she csn afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
After having calculated and evaluated the last period, the Sari Wangi Ternak group decided to continue their loan. The loan is used for increasing their pig business by purchasing new piglets or quality feed. The group received the same loan amount in which each of them get 1,5M IDR.
Ni Kadek used her loan to purchase three super quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovated the cage. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to get a good price. She hopes her plan is running well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their business until they are ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina manages her own garden plot as an aid to her husband's income as an OFW. She grows assorted vegetables in her backyard garden and sells it in the market. She has been doing this for two years. She had joined GDMPC in 2011 and has requested a new loan recently to buy additional variety of seeds and fertilizer. She plan to save a portion of her profit for the future education of her two children.

loans.use: to buy an additional variety of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Catarina Armida

texts.es:
Catarina, ha decidido solicitar de nuevo capital para invertir en la comprá de golosinas, frijoles, arroz, sal, azúcar entre otros productos para surtir la tienda que tiene, con lo que aumentara sus ventas, tendrá satisfechos a sus clientes y seguirá trabajando sin problemas.
Con el préstamo anterior logro surtir lo suficiente la tienda para que le diera ingresos que utilizo para cancelar pequeñas deudas que tenía y darle a su familia más apoyo.
texts.en: Catarina has decided to request a new loan which she will use to buy snacks, beans, rice, salt, sugar, and other products to stock her store.  This will allow her to increase her sales, keep her customers satisfied, and continue working without any problems.  With her previous loan she was able to stock her store sufficiently to earn income which she used to pay off some small debts and to support her family more.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beans, rice, salt, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Rosie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 43 years old and has four children.  Letecia is married and has three children who are in school. Letecia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Letecia has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Imelda requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Imelda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Junalie

texts.en:
Junalie is 43 years old, married, and a very hard working entrepreneur who helps her husband to generate income in the family.  Junalie has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Junalie requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, spices, etc.

Junalie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Junalie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Helen has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.  Helen aspires to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ready-to-wear clothes like shorts, pants, shirts, etc., to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for four years.

In the future Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothes like shorts, pants, shirts, etc., to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.  Tessie has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.  She has an old clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Elvira is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell for herl old clothes business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Aileen requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes to sell .

Aileen has been in this business for nine years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothes to sell

loans.name: Elsa Maribel

texts.es:
Elsa de 28 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora, luchadora y  responsable, todo con el fin  de darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia, es decir, alimentación, vestuario, vivienda y salud. Ella estudio  hasta 5to grado, es casada, su esposo trabaja como albañil, sus tres hijos viven con ellos en la casa, y los tres estudian.

   Ella hace pan para vender, tres días por semana, aparte de eso recibe remesas que le envía una prima. Ella tiene 4 años de ser panadera. Manifestó que aprendió a elaborar  pan,  porque su madre  lo hacía y ella cuando más joven no tenía nada más que hacer se ponía a ayudarle, después se acostumbró, fue como decidió hacerlo por si sola y salir a venderlo, porque en la casa no terminaba de venderlo. Por el momento, solo a eso se dedica. Antes de  ser panadera solo de dedicaba a los oficios de su hogar. Su esposo le ayuda en la compra de la materia prima,  para poder hacer el pan. El horario de trabajo es variable, a veces hace el pan en la mañana y sale a venderlo en la tarde y otras veces lo hace en las tarde y sale a vender en las mañanas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para construir un muro de retención detrás de su casa, porque en la época lluviosa se desprende tierra y dificulta que el agua drene con facilidad, para ello comprara 10 bolsas de cemento,  2 quintales de hierro y un viaje de arena.  La necesidad de comprar todo el material, que necesita para su construcción esto ayudara a que la pared no se le dañe con la tierra que cae.

   Ella pretende mejorar su negocio, esto lo va lograr comprando más materia prima y produciendo más.  Por otra parte, ampliar su casa para que sus hijos vivan mejor, y ayudar con esfuerzos  y dedicación a sus hijos para que estudien y se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 28, is a hard-working, tenacious, and responsible person.  She is this way in order to give her family better living conditions, that is to say, food, clothing, housing, and good health.  She went to school until the fifth grade.  She is married, and her husband works as a bricklayer.  Her three children live in the house with them, and they go to school.

Three days a week she makes bread to sell.  Besides that, she gets remittances that a cousin sends her.  She has been a baker for four years.  She says that she learned to make bread because her mother did.  When she was younger and did not have anything else to do, she helped her mother.  After she got used to it, she decided to do it by herself.  She went out to sell it because it did not get all sold out at home.  For the moment, this is her only business.  Before she was a baker, she solely devoted herself to the household chores.  Her husband helps her buy the raw material so that she is able to make the bread.  Her work schedule varies.  Sometimes she makes the bread in the morning and goes to sell it in the afternoon.  Other times she makes it in the afternoons and goes out to sell it in the mornings.

She is requesting the loan to build a retaining wall in back of her house.  She wants to do this because during the raining season the dirt breaks loose and that makes it difficult for the water to drain.  In order to do this she will buy ten bags of cement, two ‘quintales' [a quintal is 100 pounds] of iron, and a truckload of sand.  Purchasing all the materials she needs for the construction will help so that the wall will not be damaged by the dirt that gets broken up.

She intends to improve her business.  She will do this by purchasing more raw materials and producing more.  She will also expand her house so that her children will live better.  With effort and dedication she will help her children get an education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of cement, two ‘quintales’ [a quintal is 100 pounds] of iron, and a truckload of sand.

loans.name: Cirilo Isaias

texts.es: Cirilo nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú), él tiene 53 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de comestibles pues tiene un negocio familiar con su esposa quien la encarga del negocio es ella. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Cirilo was born in the city of Salvación and that’s where he currently lives. (Salvación is located in the Manu district in the province of Manu in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.) He is 53 years old, married, and has 2 children, who are the fruit of his beautiful relationship. He is a hardworking and enterprising person who helps his family get ahead. His main economic activity is selling groceries. He has a family business with his wife, who is in charge of it. It’s been several years since he’s had the business and he sees how well it’s going thanks to the efforts he puts into his work.

Cirilo belongs to the communal bank ‘Las Palmeras del Manu.’ At this time, he needs a loan to buy goods such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, and other items. Cirilo appreciates and values the loan and agrees to comply with the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy goods such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is married and has four children.  She has helped her husband managing their own farm for a living. She has been doing this activity for four years, earning well from her bananas and coconuts. She was able to support her four children's secondary school and has planned to save for their college education. She was determined enough to improve her farm for she wants to improve the general living of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and salt

loans.name: Eldemilia

texts.en: Eldemilia is from Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, married, and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tricycle transportation and rental service. From six years in the business, she earns well for their daily living. In 2006, Eldemilia joined GDMPC, and her previous loan that she used for maintenance was successfully repaid. Recently, she requests a new loan to buy new tires for the motorcycle to have a better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the motorcycle

loans.name: Armando Jr.

texts.en: Armando lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is a single entrepreneur and has been earning his living by providing transportation services for six years. Armando earns well so that he was able to support his parent's needs. He used his previous loan from GDMPC microcredit for motor repair and it was successfully repaid. He requests a new loan recently to buy a new set of tires to offer better services to his costumers. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Avelyn

texts.en: Avelyn has been running her canteen for a year and she earns well for the family. She is widow and her three children are still studying.  Being the only provider of the family, Avelyn has never been tired thinking of the better future of her children, and this is her inspiration to make things easy. She borrowed from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients to cook, in addition to her offerings. She wants to improve her business and wants to build a general store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to cook

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena manages a retail store in their community to earn a living. She also buys coconuts and resells them in town for more income. She has been doing this for a year, earning well aside from farming. She requested a new loan from GDMPC where she had joined recently.  She wants to buy more grocery goods for the retail store and more coconuts to resell. She always finds ways how to augment their living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for the retail store and more coconuts to resell

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en: Juanito operates a food vending business in the local community to earn a living. He has done it for six years with the help of his wife, earning well enought that he was able to provide for the needs of his family. His previous loan from GDMPC micro-credit was successfully repaid. Currently, he requested  a new loan to purchase raw ingredients to cook and sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to cook and sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a welding shop in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and pay laborers salaries for her welding business.

Nelly has been in this business for 17 years. Nelly earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.  Nelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and pay laborers' salaries for her welding shop

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang and all members of Triwana Sari are very grateful to MUK, which has given the new loan. 

Ni Komang is a housewife who is married and has two children; both of them still in school. Ni Komang been running a pig business since she was married. As a group leader of Triwana Sari, Ni Komang and each member of the group received 1.5M IDR to develop pig farming. 

With funds provided, Ni Komang will purchase feed and two superior piglets. 

Ni Komang hopes cooperation between the group and MUK will run continuously until they could have their own capital for breeding pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and two superior piglets.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo nació en la ciudad de Calca pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Salvación.  (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú), él tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la agricultura donde cosecha plátanos, coca, piña, yuca y otros productos agrícolas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Las Palmeras del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Guillermo was born in the city of Calca, but he currently lives in the city of Salvación. (The city of Salvación is located in the district of Manu, in Manu province, in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.) He is 37 years old and has a common-law marriage, from which he has two children. He is a hard-working and enterprising person who is helping his family get ahead. His main economic activity is agriculture, and he grows plantains, coca leaves, pineapples, yuca and other agricultural products. He has dedicated himself to this business for several years now, and it is going very well for him thanks to the dedication he puts into his work. He belongs to the communal bank “Las Palmeras del Manu” ["The Palm Trees of Manu"], and on this occasion he needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. He is grateful for the loan and appreciates it, and he is committed to fulfilling his monthly payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman from the town of Albur, Bohol, Philippines. Elsa is a fish vendor, and has been in the business for more than 30 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Elsa is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish that she can sell in the community of Albur for more income. 

With the additional capital, she will have the chance to generate more profits to meet the needs of the family, especially for their daily food consumption and to pay their bills.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es: Luz, a sus 30 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos de 5 y 9 años.  Desde el año 2008, luego de analizar diversas alternativas para invertir unos ahorros que tenía, vio en el comercio de mercancía la mejor opción y, aprovechó la oportunidad que se le presentó con el traslado de su esposo para la ciudad, pues allí podría comprar la mercancía a menor costo y enviarla a su ciudad natal, donde su madre la ofrece a vecinos y amigos, adicionalmente ella la ofrece en el batallón donde reside, pues su esposo es soldado; de esta forma ha generado los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía del hogar y ha logrado brindar educación a sus hijos. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, blusas, accesorios, camisetas, entre otros), así tendrás más variedad de surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y requerimientos, especialmente en la temporada de fin de año, época en la que sus ventas se incrementan, mejorando el nivel de ingresos que percibe por su labor. Luz sueña con fortalecer su negocio para atender nuevos clientes y poder ofrecer mercancía de marcas reconocidas, que no había podido incluir en su portafolio, pues son costosas, pero que ahora con el apoyo del crédito tendrá la posibilidad de hacerlo; su motivación es seguir velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y tener la posibilidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Luz, at the age of 30, is married and the mother of two children, aged 5 and 9. In 2008, after analyzing various options for investing some savings she had, she decided that selling merchandise was her best option. She took advantage of the opportunity that arose when her husband was transferred to the city, because there she could buy the merchandise at a lower cost and send it to her hometown, where her mother offers it to neighbors and friends. Additionally, she offers it at the military base where she lives, since her husband is a soldier. In this way, she has generated sufficient resources to contribute to her household economy, and she has been able to provide education to her children. 

She is motivated to request this loan because she aims to invest in buying merchandise on a wholesale basis (jeans, blouses, accessories and t-shirts, among other items). Thus she will have a greater variety of stock to offer her customers, so that she can satisfy their diverse tastes and needs, especially during the end-of-year season, a time in which her sales increase. This will improve the level of income she receives for her work. Luz dreams of strengthening her business to serve new customers and to offer merchandise from recognized brands, which she has not been able to include in her portfolio since they are expensive. Now, however, with the help of the loan, she will have the possibility of doing this. Her motivation is to continue ensuring her children's well-being and to have the opportunity to improve the quality of life for all of her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (jeans, blouses, accessories, t-shirts, and others).

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth helped her husband managing their own rice farm for a living. She has been in this activity for eight years, earning well for their family needs. She borrowed from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase a new variety of seedlings and fertilizer for the next crops. She is hopeful to gain more returns from her investments. In the near future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seedlings and fertilizer for the next crops

loans.name: Elenora

texts.en:
'Hardworking mother' best describes Elenora, 50 years old, married, and from  Burgos, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. 

In 2009, she applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing, and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Elenora is asking financial assistance of Php 14,900 to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store business. 

Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store (General Store) business.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is a native man from the town of Anda, Bohol. He operates a motorcycle transport service locally known as habal-habal. He transports passengers from one barrio to another for a particular fee. To help augment the income of their household, he also goes fishing and runs a sari-sari (variety) store. 

He is asking for a loan to buy additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, and fuel for his motorcycle transport service, to continue his livelihood activities.

In the future, Feliciano hopes to expand his various businesses and increase business profitability to elevate his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, and fuel for his motorcycle transport service.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina, age 58, is happy tending her little store.  She is married and her husband is a laborer. The store is their other means of earning a living in support to her husband's income for their family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Segundina keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Segundina has reached a year being a member to Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and, from there, to be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store (General Store) business

loans.name: Lanida

texts.en:
Lanida is a 40 year-old woman from the town of Alicia, Bohol. She is married and has two school- aged children. She runs a store and sells various items ranging from  eggs, cooking oil, beverages, soap, dry goods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy various merchandise to sell, like condiments, canned goods and toiletries to cater to the needs of her customers.

In the future, Lanida hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise to sell, like condiments, canned goods and toiletries

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, is from Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines.  She is 52 years old.  She is married and has five children.  The wage that her husband gets is not adequate to sustain the daily needs in their family. So Editha started a business with a capitalization of Php 3,000.  She operates a sari-sari store (general store). She has been in the business for five years to earn additional income for their family.  In 2006, Editha applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.
Editha is now trying to expand her business, and from it she wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family needs, especially for her children. In order for Editha to realize her wish, she presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000.  She will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy all needed stock for the sari-sari store.  She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build a good business management for her loyal customers.  With her extra income, she wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her sari-sari store (General Store) business

loans.name: Obod

texts.ru: Обод жительница села района Кубадиён. Ей 40 лет. Она состоит в браке. Обод хочет начать свой бизнес по купле и продаже скотов. Ранее она только держала пару скотов у себя дома, чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком. Обод знает многое о деятельности скотоводства и теперь решила свои навыки посвятить будущему бизнесу. Обод планирует купить маленьких бычков и телят, после определенных  дней откорма продать их на скотном рынке. На сегодняшний день она занимается растениеводством, работает на плодовом поле. Но такая деятельность является сезонным. Поэтому Обод решила взять кредит и купить несколько голов скотов и начать свой бизнес. Она надеется, что ее поддержат. Обод надеется на Вашу помощь!
texts.en:
Obod is a resident of a village in the region of Qubadiyon. She is 40 years old. She is married. Obod would like to start a business of animal sales. Earlier she only held a couple of cows at her home, in order to provide her family with milk. 

Obod knows a lot about the business of livestock breeding and currently decided to devote her skills to the future business. She plans to purchase small bulls and calves. After fattening them for some time, she will sell them at the local market. 

Currently Obod works in the field with field crop cultivation, but this type of business is seasonal. Therefore, she decided to take a loan and purchase some heads of cattle and start her own business. She hopes that you will support her. Obod hopes for your help!

loans.use: to start a new business of animal sales

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia is a 45-year-old woman from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is married one child, age 11.

She goes fishing, and is engaged in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish to help augment the income of their household; her business started more than ten years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fuel for the motor boat, fishing net, and nylon to improve her catch and could sustain their family's daily needs. 

In the future, Mauricia hopes to expand her fishing business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the motor boat, fishing net, and nylon.

loans.name: Pamela Ann

texts.en:
Pamela Ann is a sari-sari store owner from Tagbilaran, Bohol. She is married with a four year old child. 

In her store, she sells basic household items like canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, chips, and snack food. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional items to sell in her store such as noodles, cooking oil, soy sauce, sugar, snacks, eggs and coffee. 

In the future, Pamela Ann dreams of making her business a success and savng money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cooking oil, soy sauce, sugar, snacks, eggs, and coffee.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a 42-year-old man from the town of CPG, Bohol. He is married with eight children. 

Eduardo engages in fishing to help augment the income of their household. He catches and sells fish as their source of livelihood; his business started five years ago. 

He is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like hooks, fishing nets, and fuel for the motor boat to improve his catch and to provide his children with enough food.

In the future, he hopes to expand his fishing business and increase business profitability for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like hooks, fishing nets, and fuel for the motor boat

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Жумагул 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Дети школьники, супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. У Жумагул и супруга очень уважительные отношения в семье. У Жумагул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жумагул занимается животноводством и полеводством, имеет достаточный опыт как в разведении скота, так и в полеводстве. Жумагул очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная. Стартовала свой бизнес 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также имеет 2,40 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации, что дает неплохие доходы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жумагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жумагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку бытовой техники для дома.
texts.en:
Jumagul is 30 years old, married and raising three children together with her husband. The children go to school and her husband helps actively with the household. Jumagul and her husband have a respectful relationship. 

Jumagul has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Jumagul works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. She has sufficient experience as a livestock breeder, and also in agriculture. Jumagul is very hardworking and purposeful. She started her business 10 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Jumagul's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow and also 2.40 hectares of land, on which she every year grows beans for selling. This gives her a good income. The monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Jumagul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows to increase the number of livestock. Jumagul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for purchasing household appliances for her home.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 25 years old. She lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is married with three kids. From her desire to help the family, she operates a sari-sari store (general store) from a starting capital of PHP 3,000, and she was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings, and she enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last September 20, 2011, and has taken out three loans. 

Now, Cristina is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities, since her husband's income is not sufficient for their daily needs. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies so that they can help her in the future. 

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Cristina is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, and others for her sari-sari store (general store) business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years of age and a resident of Tulapos, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor, Philippines. She is a widow with six children who are school age.  She has a little fishing business to earn a living.  With her business she has many challenges, but she realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Rowena work hard to sell her catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy her fish. With her savings, she welcomes the idea of expanding her business.  

She has requested a Php 5,000 loan from Paglaum MPC.  

She feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Rowena smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.
