With her previous loan, she had more satisfied clients, grew her income and business, and was able to provide her family with an improved way of life.

loans.use: to buy sausage, meat, vegetables, condiments, drinks, and rice.

loans.name: Jessica Pastora

texts.es: Jessica, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privada y vendía mercadería por pedidos. Hace 8 años que estableció un  negocio de un salón de belleza donde ofrece servicios de aplicación de tintes, corte de cabello, alisado chino, tratamientos para el cabello, uñas acrílica, manicure y pedicure etc.  El negocio lo tiene establecido en el mercado local. Ha invertido varios préstamos en el negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 12,000 lempiras  y lo va invertir en la compra de  productos para belleza como ser tintes, esmaltes, limas, cremas, champú y tratamientos para el cabello. Ella espera mejorar su inventario de insumos que utiliza en su salón. Tiene como meta comprar una casa y también para poner otro salón de belleza en un futuro.
texts.en: Jessica is 33 years old, married, has two children, and lives in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  She used to work for a private company, selling merchandise to order, but she set up his own business, a beauty salon eight years ago, where she offers services such as tints, cuts, perms, hair treatments, acrylic nails, manicures and pedicures.  Her business is located at a local market and she has invested into her business with the help of several loans.  She is requesting another loan in the amount of 12,000 Lempiras so she can buy beauty products such as tints, nail polish, emery boards, creams, shampoos, and hair treatments.  She is hoping to improve the inventory of supplies in her salon.  Her goal is to buy a house and open a second salon in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
A mother in early 60 and blessed with five children, Heang is a villager from Ksach Kandal district of Kandal province. The main sources of her family’s income are from one hectare of rice farming and a pig-raising business. This is the first microloan for Heang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Heang wants to help her grandson to achieve his dream of become a doctor. Hence, she is applying for an education loan to cover the tuition fees for her grandson. She hopes that her grandson can get a good job with a proper income to support himself as well as the family.

loans.use: To cover the tuition fee for her grandson.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Hawanatu from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself and her children. In 2007, Hawanatu established her general stock business. She works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a good marketable place to sell.

Hawanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cream, perfume and nail polish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and develop her family. In the future, Hawanatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cream, perfume and nail polish for resale.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet Aminata, a 27-year-old from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  For the past 13 years, Aminata has established her retail business. She began her business because she wants generates a permanent source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that her business is doing well because she makes profit.

Aminata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and coconut oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Aminata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and coconut oil to expand her business

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en: Haseena, age 30, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatma

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatma is 45 years old and a married woman. Her husband is a laborer. She has seven children for a total of nine members in her home. It was very tough for her to manage her household needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. 

For this purpose she started her business selling cloth where she buys cloths of different varities from the wholesale market and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. For the improvement of her business, she applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors, taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history,

loans.use: to purchase more variety of cloths in different colors.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 32-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Maryam has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Maryam is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar, age 28, is a married woman and the mother of three. She has been selling milk with her husband for many years.  She has three cows which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality.

Kousar needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and health. In order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy one more cow to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar de 63 años de edad se dedica  a la crianza de ganado de doble propósito (producción de leche y ganado de engorde) desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Oscar está solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para el ganado ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así el podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Oscar is 63 years old and has been raising livestock with a dual purpose (milk production and fattening up) for various years.  He is able to cover some of his household expenses with what he earns.  Oscar is asking for a loan to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for his livestock, since this is his only source of work.  In this way he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life without limits.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Sandra Estela

texts.es: Sandra vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija de 24 años de edad, ella se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maiz, frijoles, hárinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es una mujer emprendedor, dedicada  a su labor, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y sus dos molinos ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en: Sandra lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and 24 year old daughter.  She works her mill and processes all types of food, such as corn, beans, flours, salsas, and other things.  She has had this business for some time and has lots of experience that helps her have good earnings.  She is well known by the local people and has many customers who prefer to buy from her because of the quality products, good prices, and unequalled service.  She is an enterprising woman, dedicated to her work and her customer demand has increased in the recent weeks, but her two mills can no longer keep up.  She is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL so she can buy a new mill.  She has good credit references, is responsible, and promises to repay the debt.  She also has faith that she will bring financial and emotional stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy a mill.

loans.name: Micaela Bastida Ii Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 9  personas emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “Micaela Bastida II”.  La Sra. demesia  de 53 años de edad casada  y madre de  5 hijos, ella se dedica hace 7 años  a la venta de comida tanto en le día como en la noche r.  La Sra. Demesia     ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su comida y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá   en  ampliar su local   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Demesia   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  ,  A la sra. demesia se le distingue con su chompa de color verde, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas
texts.en:
This communal group, "Micaela Bastida II" is made up of nine enterprising people who bring a lot of creativity to their businesses.  The featured borrower is Demesia.  She is fifty-three years old, is married, and has five children.  She has been making a living selling food during both the day and night for seven years.  Demesia has built up a loyal customer base, allowing her to generate better profits in order to cover home expenses.  

In the future, she would like to have her own stall where she could sell her foods and obtain even better economic profits.  With the requested loan, she will invest in founding her business premises, which will allow her to move herself ahead. 

Demesia and all the group members are grateful to Kiva.  In the photo, Demesia is in the green sweater.  She would like to close her message in saying that she will keep her promise to work towards all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to enlarge her business premises.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Martha is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling salted fish, tomatoes, garden eggs, pepper, etc in Abrafo (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 5 years. Martha is divorced without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her support herself and her extended family. She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of salted fish, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. In the long term, Martha plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of salted fish, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Growing up in poverty without education has not stopped Adjoa from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, she is an entrepreneur. She sells soft drinks like malt, Fanta, Sprite, etc. in Abrafo (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she started it 7 years ago. Adjoa is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of soft drinks. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her meet her customers' needs and expand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of soft drinks.

loans.name: Feliciana Del Socorrro

texts.es: Doña Feliciana a su edad es una señora muy trabajadora, en la actualidad vende  fritanga por las noches y un poco de ropa variada en el día, ubicada en su casa de habitación, trabaja junto a su esposo quien es jubilado, ambos se apoyan para salir adelante. Doña Feliciana solicita el crédito para poder aumentar el número de platos de comida al día, más ahora que se acercan las festividades de fin de año en donde desea aprovechar para aumentar sus ingresos economicos, con el préstamo comprara granos básicos, aceite, carnes, verduras, frutas.
texts.en: Feliciana, at her age, is a very hardworking woman who sells fried foods in the evenings, and a bit of clothing during the day.  She works out of her home alongside her husband who is retired and they help one another get ahead.  Feliciana is asking for this loan to be able to increase the number of dishes she can produce each day, especially now that the end of year festivals are approaching and she wants to take advantage of this to increase her income.  She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, meats, vegetables, and fruits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Taypi Marka * 26 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento TAYPI MARKA * 26,  está compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco  mujeres y tres varones,  todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Yolanda, tiene 46 años y es casada,  ella se dedica al bordado de artesanías, se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo aprendió esta actividad de sus padres que también eran artesanos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de telas e hilos para el bordado de sus artesanías, la señora Yolanda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que el trabajo es un poco moroso por realizarlo manualmente,  Va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su trabajo, su deseo para su negocio es  ampliar la venta poniendo una tienda donde pueda exponer su trabajo ya que ahora solo lo realiza a pedido y entrega a distintos lugares donde le hacen pedidos  y así de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The TAYPI MARKA *26 entrepreneurial bank is made up eight members, five women and three men, all with different businesses.  Yolanda is the bank’s president.  She is 46 years old, married, and has been doing embroidery for some time.  She learned this activity from her parents who were also artists.  This will be her first loan through the institution and she will use the money to buy fabric and thread.  Yolanda faces challenges in that the work is a bit tedious to do by hand.  She will use the benefits to continue improving her work and her goal is to set up a store where she can work strictly on order and then deliver to her customers.  In this way she hopes to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Señora Rosmery sigue con la misma actividad entretenimiento con su discoteca donde le va muy bien,  cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra mesas y sillas para su negocio, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de equipos para así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos se siente feliz y agradecida con Kiva por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Rosemery continues to run a disco, and things are going very well for her.  She says that things went very well with the previous loan and she used the money to buy tables and chairs for her business.  She is asking for a loan to buy equipment so she can continue improving her business and income.  She is happy and grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Musulmon

texts.ru: Мусулмон является одним из активных студентов Медицинского колледжа. Он учится на 3 курсе по специальности дантиста. Мусулмон с детства мечтал стать медиком и после окончания средней школы с помощью своих родителей он поступил в Медицинский колледж. Он считает, что выбрал хорошею профессию, так как лечить больных это самое благотворительное дело. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но в этом году его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Musulmon is a third-year student specializing in dentistry and one of the most active students in his medical school. He has dreamed of becoming a doctor since childhood and after finishing high school, with the help of his parents, he enrolled in medical school. He believes he has chosen a worthwhile profession, since treating the sick is the most charitable of actions. 

Musulmon needs to pay for his education costs, but this year his parents are unable to cover the costs. He is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a thirty-nine-year-old woman. She is married to Peter and together they have three children. She owns a farm in Kimende in the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in this business for thirteen years now; she gets a monthly income of 35,000 shillings.

This will be Susan's fourth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. She wants to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Eten, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día como cajera en una pequeña tienda de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante; Doris cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrada.

Doris esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar enseres para su vivienda, asi como también podrá comprar una cama ya que actualmente duerme en una hecha de palos de eucalipto, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un restaurante y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Doris is a 29 year old woman. She lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Eten. She works about 9 hours a day as a cashier in a small store in her city, which gives her enough income to get ahead. Doris feels that things are going well for her due to her responsibility and honesty.

Doris is grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to this loan she can buy household goods for her home and also buy a bed. Right now she sleeps in a bed made from eucalyptus branches. In this way she can improve her quality of living and continue to struggle towards her big dream which is to study at university.

loans.use: to buy household goods and a bed.

loans.name: Amahoriwacu Group

texts.fr:
Spès  fait partie du groupe  Amahoriwacu  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 41ans et est mariée à P. Claver. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants  âgés de 5 à 18 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce  de banane  et de  poissons (ndagala)  depuis 3 ans. 

Elle  est son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Spès is part of the group Amahoriwacu and lives in Gitega. She is 41 years old and married to P. Claver. Together they have five children, from 5 to 18 years old, of whom four are students. 

Spès has been doing commerce in bananas and fish (ndagala) for three years. 

She is on her second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Kwizera Group

texts.fr:
Patrice  fait partie du groupe  Kwizera  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 60 ans et est marié à Rose. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants  âgés de 18 à  22 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce  d’habits depuis 3 ans. 

Il  est son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter une parcelle, construire une belle maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Patrice is part of the group Kwizera and lives in Bujumbura. He is 60 years old and married to Rose. Together they have three children from 18 to 22 years old, of whom two are students. 

Patrice has been doing commerce in clothing for three years. 

He is on his second Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a plot of land, build a nice house, and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Rene Jonaz

texts.es:
Rene de 27 años de edad, es una persona muy esforzada y líder de la comunidad, estudio hasta 9° en la comunidad, el bachillerato no lo pudo  realizar por que había que viajar hasta otro lugar y las condiciones económicas no le permitieron continuar,; es por eso,  que se dedica a trabajar  la agricultura al lado de su padre, desde muy corta edad, lo ha realizado. Él vive aún con sus padres y 2 sobrinos y sus hermanos  están fuera del país y  han dejado  a su cargo el cuidado de los niños  y también de sus  padres.

El trabajo agrícola lo realiza desde muy corta edad, eso le permite contar con una gran experiencia, para cultivar la tierra año con año. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para la construcción del piso de su casa, ya que es de tierra y en el invierno la situación se vuelve complicada, los materiales a utilizar son: 8 bolsas de cemento, 2 mt de arena, 60 ladrillos de obra para levantar 30 centímetros del suelo y que no entre la tierra a lo reparado. 

En el futuro desea realizar sus estudios pendientes, para tener una opción de incorporarse al mundo  laboral y así darle  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rene is 27 years old and is a very determined person and community leader.  He has a ninth grade education and he was not able to work toward a bachelor’s degree because he would have needed to travel to another area and financial conditions did not permit him to continue.  For this reason he decided to work in farming alongside his father from a young age.  He lives with his parents and two nephews.  His brothers are outside the country and have left their children and parents in his charge.

He has been farming from a young age, which has provided him with lots of experience in cultivating the land year after year.

He will the money from this loan to install a floor in his house, as the current one is a dirt floor and that makes the winters difficult.  He will use 8 bags of cement, 2 meters of sand, and 60 bricks to create 30 centimeters of floor so that the dirt will not enter.

In the future he wants to complete school so that he will have to option of incorporating himself into the working world and be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to install a floor in his home.

loans.name: Oneyda Esperanza

texts.es: Oneyda, tiene 34 años de edad, vive  en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene una hija y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Anteriormente vendía tortillas y hace 1 años  se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para caballeros, damas y niños como ser  shorts, blusas, jeans, camisas, camisetas, vestidos etc. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y cuenta con buena clientela.  El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más mercadería de ropa de segunda mano como ser jeans, camisas, blusas, pantalones y ropa de niño,  para obtener mejor inventario y mejores ventas.  Ella piensa ahorrar para poder tener su propia casa y darle la educación a su hija.
texts.en: Oneyda is 34 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her husband.  They have a daughter and they live in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  She used to sell tortillas, but one year ago she decided to sell men’s, women’s, and children’s used clothing, such as shorts, blouses, jeans, shirts, t-shirts, dresses, etc.  Her business is in her home and she has a good number of customers.  She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to invest in more merchandise such as second hand jeans, shirts, blouses, pants, and children’s clothing to have a better inventory and increase her sales.  She wants to save up to be able to have a home of her own and provide an education for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, es un hombre que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura para ayudar a su padre a llevar el alimento a su familia. No obstante, hoy que ya es padre de tres hijos, lo realiza con mayor empeño, además de la agricultura, tiene un empleo  en una granja donde funge como vigilante de las instalaciones, su esposa se dedica al 100% del cuidado de sus  hijos  y el quehacer del hogar.  

En el área agrícola la experiencia es basta, ya que desde muy corta edad al lado de su padre se ha dedicado  a labrar la tierra, en su empleo como vigilante la experiencia es de  2 años.

El préstamo será utilizado, para realizar el pago de una deuda que obtuvo para la construcción de su vivienda, la cual fue otorgada con intereses altos y le ocasiona serios problemas a la hora de mantener a su familia, por lo alto de los intereses. Con esta ayuda lograra nivelar su economía  y podrá dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  

En el futuro,  mediante sus hijos crezcan piensa realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda,  además de eso mantener a sus hijos motivados  a estudiar, proveerles todo lo necesario, para que en el futuro  sean profesionales de bien.
texts.en:
Jose is 28 years old and has been working as a farmer since he was very young, helping his father feed his family.  Now he is a father himself, and has three children.  Aside from farming, he also works as a guard at another farm.  His wife is a fulltime mother and homemaker.

He has lots of farming experience, since he worked at his father’s side at a very young age.  He has been a guard for two years.

He will use the money from this loan to repay a construction loan for his home, which carries a high interest rate and causes him problems with supporting his family because of the high interest rate.  This assistance will help him level his finances and provide a better quality of life for his family.

In the future, as his children grow, he will make some improvements to his home.  He will also keep his children motivated to continue their educations, and provide them with all they need s that they can become professionals of means.

loans.use: to repay a previous loan.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace tres años por iniciativa propia, lo hace con el fin de generar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir todos los gastos de hogar. Él está acompañado, vive junto a su compañera de vida.
Solicita capital para invertir en la compra 2 cerdos y pulimento para alimentarlos, cuando ya estén lo suficientemente gordos los venderá, espera tener más ingresos, un negocio más productivo y cancelar las deudas.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más amplio y estable que le de las ganancias necesarias para tener un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
José has earned a living for three years raising pigs on his own.  He does it to generate the income he needs to cover his household expenses.  He lives with his life partner.

José's requesting the capital to invest in buying two pigs and feed to nourish them.  He'll sell them when they're fat enough.

José hopes to earn more income, have a more productive business, and pay back his debts.  His dream is to have a bigger and more stable business that will give him the profits he needs to leave a better legacy.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and feed

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.fr: Marguerite est une jeune femme de 49 ans mariée , mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 10 et 26 ans. Tous vont déjà au collège. elle a ouvert et gère une boutique de vente emportée de boissons depuis 2 ans. son activité fonctionne mais elle manque souvent de stock parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité parce que son capital ne lui permet pas de faire autrement. Elle est obligée à chaque fois de faire écouler tout son stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer un nouveau. D'où son besoin de ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter des casiers de boisson . Le bénéfice lui permettra d'agrandir sa structure. Elle économisera le reste pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Marguerite is a young woman, 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children, from 10 to 26 years old. Everyone has been to middle school. Marguerite opened a store and has been running it for two years selling take-out beverages. Her business is doing well, but she often lacks inventory to sell, since her capital does not allow otherwise. She is always compelled to sell her entire inventory in order to procure more, thus the need for a loan enabling her to have more cases of beverages. The profit will allow her to expand her organization. She will save the rest of the money for her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks to sell

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo2, Eastern Rural Area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children. She started her business to take care of her family.

Kadiatu runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, pure water and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes purchasing is very slow.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, pure water and cooking seasonings

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Mbalu from Waterloo2, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 years and 23 years.  She started her business for daily survival for her family.
 
Mbalu runs a cookery business, and she sells the products of her cookery within her area. She has been running this business since 2004. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week.   Mbalu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Mbalu has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice for preparation in her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice for preparation in her cookery business.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Meet Finda. She is 50 years old and from the eastern area of Jui in Freetown. She is married with five children. In 2003, Finda established her business, which she began because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., seven days per week. She says that at present, her business is doing well.

Finda requires a loan in order to purchase more rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Finda plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance through its Ishaka branch and has so far borrowed thrice all in effort to grow his business and increase his income base. He is a married man and he has two children. Leonard also stays with two dependants who are his parents and he says he feels obliged to give them the care they deserve since they helped him grow. His major source of income is the transport business where he uses a motorcycle to transport people to and from different places. He works five days in a week and works for ten hours every day worked. His work station is within Ishaka and he started the business with an aim of getting income to cater for the needs of his family. His clients are mainly passengers in the same area and his challenges are the risky ones who sometimes never pay after reaching their destinations. 

Despite the challenges, Leonard is hopeful that with his hard work he will be able to establish and sustain his family. 

Since he also sells coffee besides the main transport business, he would like to use the one million three hundred thousand shillings loan to buy a stock of  coffee beans which he will later sell at a profit since he does farming on a small-scale as well.

loans.use: to buy coffee beans to sell.

loans.name: Noral

texts.en: Norah is a resident of a village in Mbarara municipality with children. She got married when she was 17 years old to a man she loved, but their parents were against it. The husband had no source of income and looking after the children became a problem. She and her husband joined hands and got a loan from Ugafode that they used to start a small retail shop. This shop has grown, supporting the family's survival. They have also managed to build a house and they are requesting a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete it.

loans.use: To complete construction of her house

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 32-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband Johiruddin and their two children in their own kachha ( mud and straw made) house in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. Johiruddin is 42 years old and a cycle-van puller by profession. He earns their livelihood by carrying goods and people in his cycle-van from one place to another. Both Hamida and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. One of their children goes to school and reads in class IV (Grade 4).  The other is below school-going age.

Hamida wants to give financial support to her husband and plans to grow potatoes. Hamida has heard about BJS and applied for the loan so that they can purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate in their land.  This business is very lucrative and has a good demand in the local market. They hope to get a good harvest and make a good profit from it.

They hope to upgrade their poor financial condition in future, give good education to their children, and expand their business with the profit generated.

loans.use: to buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Belqees

texts.en: Belqees is a 27-year-old vigorous lady and mother of two children.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shokat

texts.en:
Shokat is a 46-year-old married woman. She has four children: two daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to support them, which includes providing food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Shokat started her business sewing clothes to contribute in the family income, and she is well familiar with stitching techniques. She requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a new stitching machine, along with some spools of threads, cloths, buttons and needles, so she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a new stitching machine, along with some spools of threads, cloths, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Slamah

texts.en:
Slamah is 24 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Slamah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential items. 

To help expand her business, Slamah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential items to sell in the shop, and will help Slamah to generate greater profits and educate her children. Slamah hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a wholesale shop. 

Slamah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential items for the shop to sell.

loans.name: Yolani Suilen

texts.es:
La joven Yonali es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y verduras, desde hace 4 años.
Yonali su negocio lo realiza desde su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos que recorre ofreciendo su producto. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de faldas, vestidos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, calzonetas, etc.  Para seguir realizando su trabajo.
Yolani espera que esta inversión le ayude mucho ya que en esta temporada navideña este tipo de producto se vende y así con las ganancias le permita crecer más en su negocio y a su vez que le genere los suficientes ingresos para seguir apoyando a su familia.  
Yolani su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijas y que sus tengan los estudios necesarios y así lograr mayores oportunidades en  la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Yonali is a hard-working and responsible young person who lives with her family in the south of Honduras. She has been selling clothes and vegetables for 4 years. Yonali does her business from her home in the municipality where she lives and in the neighboring communities where she goes to offer her product.

Yonali needs a loan to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, swimwear, etc. to continue with her work. Yonali hopes that this loan will help her a lot in this Christmas season when everything sells. She can expand her business with the profits and at the same time make enough money to continue to support her family.

Yonali's dream is to see her children grow up and have the necessary studies and have better opportunities in their lives.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, blouses, shirts, pants, swimwear, etc. for her business.
